Why are the all the oldest threads in the lounge locked?

> 
> 
> 47 minutes ago, catloaf said:
> 
> 
> Why are the all the oldest threads in the lounge locked?
> 

When the forums first started, there weren't many sub forums, so almost all the old threads were lumped together into one sub.   So anything KSP and non KSP related were are jumbled together.  Since most of the KSP related ones from back then are woefully outdated, there is no reason to keep them going.   And due to migrating the forum to new software a couple different times, the formatting on most of them are messed up.  Also the forum rules have evolved since then, and there's some content from way back that wouldn't be allowed today, which is part of the reason we have those rules.

If there's a topic worth reopening for discussion, then start a new thread on the topic, and link the old thread.   But let's not go digging up old threads just for the sake of it, if it's a pertinent addition to the thread, or you have a topic of conversation that an old thread has relevant arguments to, then by all means, start a new one and link the old locked thread. 

If you think there might be an issue with an old thread you'd like to link, just report it, and explain what you want to do with it, and we'll get back to you on it.
If they're locked, no new posts would bump them to the top so over time they will be left behind by newer and more active threads.
